> [aspidochelone](#comment_298_1PPUrYcZ1E1rGkkE6PH18Qi43LRsKABo1Z): I don't know what this is all about but you seem obsessed with sex and conspiracy, so let's get to the bottom of this. [...]

I agree there is loads of HBTQ+ propaganda, ads for contraceptives for pregnancy etc.
What happens when population is below replacement is welfare system fails, you can see this happening in europe.
Economists in Sweden is getting shaky because it will probably fail sooner than expected,
more than 1 in 10 swedish women refuse to get kids, and the rest gets around 1-2 kids, well below replacement rate.

They did however increase migration to over 100k people per year, completely draining the welfare systems, giving away apartments and houses otherwise needed for swedish citizens. (There is a big housing crisis)
Leading to housing prices completely exploding meaning no one in the younger generation can afford whats available.

How could they do a miscalculation this big?
I seriously don't understand how the nation leaders can let this happen.. It's a treason beyond my comprehension.

> [h3bhkj5gqz4n3pjm](#comment_1499_1CKTRBy9N4RvE3FgeZJpQqFYtLHc37yo11): You have to see the problem more broadly, and understand that periodically nature erases civilizations. Are you kidding? It's because of social pressure and failing economy that people avoid making babies.
Migrants get housing and welfare paychecks for free plus extra welfare paychecks the more babies they make,
meanwhile the indigenous people is living paycheck to paycheck and cannot afford buying a basic apartment,
nor renting a medium sized one that is appropriate for raising a kid.

1579514127_1NZftAz9VSawGF5JgMYGFv4ByoKEa.body:
> [ranshit](#comment_59_17XPGJDqy3F7zfV3sa4aMJF2Mhpati6N12): Most mechanics will use instructional Youtube videos to help find a solution to a problem on a piece of machinery they haven't worked with before. [...]

As a mechanic, I approve this. Sometimes videos on YouTube have some good information on most basic stuff.
Sometimes there is good tips there that you can use if it's a model you never worked with before.


Most of the time however, I only look at spec sheets or manual for which torque and how many degrees screws need to be tighten at, and electronic schematics and spec sheets when i am doing troubleshooting.
YouTube don't help very much when it comes to that..
